{"step_by_step_thinking": "Thyroglossal duct cysts are congenital anomalies, so option D is true. They can indeed become infected, so option A is also true. They are most commonly found in the midline of the neck and are often located at or just below the level of the hyoid bone, so option C is true. However, thyroglossal duct cysts are typically lined by squamous or columnar epithelium, not pseudostratified columnar epithelium.", "answer_choice": "B"}
